div.p: Greetings. The bearer of this letter to you is the scribe of our monastery.

He has recommended his son to Mr. Gwalther, whom he wishes to devote himself to studies in your school, and I beseech you to occasionally look after him. He was my companion for over two years, he is a pious and good boy; I hope he will make better progress with you. Furthermore, my godfather, who is planning a journey to you, was very eager to have the opportunity to meet you; hence, he helped me as much as he could to gather what you have long requested and expected, but I have not yet received from only two places; which I hope to receive shortly and perhaps even today. I found more than I had hoped for; by Thursday or Friday, you will receive them, God willing. There is no news with us; various rumors are spreading about the Valesians; there are strange practices heard from 5 or 7 Swiss Cantons, which, unless the Lord averts, will end in the ruin of Switzerland. It is rumored that Hesse and the Palatinate are working on holding a conference between the Lutherans and the Zwinglians, and that you and Martyr have already been called and summoned by them.
However, nothing is certain to us.
If you have any leisure, please inform us of what you can.
Farewell in the Lord with all the pious.
To the man endowed with singular learning, piety, and humanity, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, Antistes of the Church of Zürich, his most esteemed lord and brother in Christ.
